description: Of Latin origin, via or reinforced by Old French matriarche, from Latin māter (“mother”) + -archa, -arches, from Ancient Greek -άρχης (-árkhēs), from ἀρχός (arkhós, “chief”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *h₂ergʰ- (“to begin, rule, command”). Surface analysis matri- +‎ -arch.

definitionGroups.group: A female leader of a family, a tribe or an ethnic or religious group.

entries.meaning: The dominant female in a family group of elephants
A female founder of a political or religious movement, an organization or an enterprise.
